content:
• Tuesday, February 21, 2012
  • TRAK

    More on DealerTrack Holdings (NASDAQ:TRAK): Q4 beats on better than expected auto sales volume...

    More on DealerTrack Holdings (NASDAQ:TRAK): Q4 beats on better than expected auto sales volume and higher average transaction revenue per car sold. The stock is trading lower after hours however, as the company lowers FY12 guidance. It now expects an EPS of $0.99 - $1.06, versus the Street view of $1.09. Shares -5.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM
  • YGE

    Solar-panel maker Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) lowers its forecast for Q4 shipments and gross...

    Solar-panel maker Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) lowers its forecast for Q4 shipments and gross margins, and says it will record $361M in impairment charges and an inventory provision amid difficult solar market conditions. It now expects PV module shipments to fall 30% versus its previous forecast of around a 20% decline, and its gross margin will be approximately 3%, down from its previous estimate of 10%. Shares -8.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • INTU

    More on Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): FQ2 EPS beats expectations on a 62% jump in net profit. Overall...

    More on Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): FQ2 EPS beats expectations on a 62% jump in net profit. Overall revenue rose 16% Y/Y on better than expected sales from its TurboTax and QuickBooks tax preparation businesses. The company also raises its FY12 EPS guidance to between $2.90 - $2.97 per share. Shares +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT) falls 2.3% AH after announcing a 5M share stock offering,...

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT) falls 2.3% AH after announcing a 5M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $228.3M based on today's close. The news is overshadowing Wesport's guidance hike: the company now expects to report 2011 revenue of $260M-$264M, above prior guidance of $240M-$250M. Westport also expects 2012 revenue of $400M-$425M, above an FY13 (ends March '13) consensus of $347M.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM
  • TWO

    Two Harbors Investment (NYSE:TWO) falls 2.4% AH after announcing a 30M share stock offering,...

    Two Harbors Investment (NYSE:TWO) falls 2.4% AH after announcing a 30M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $306.9M based on today's close. The REIT plans to use the proceeds to make additional purchases of residential mortgage-backed securities.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • FIRE

    More on Sourcefire's (NASDAQ:FIRE) Q4: The Q4 beat was fueled by a 51% increase in channel...

    More on Sourcefire's (NASDAQ:FIRE) Q4: The Q4 beat was fueled by a 51% increase in channel sales, and a 36% increase in U.S. commercial sales. This offset relatively muted growth (7%) in government sales. Deferred revenue rose 14.5% Q/Q to $61.6M. The company expects Q1 revenue of $40M-$42M and EPS of $0.06-$0.08, compared with a consensus of $38.3M and $0.07. Shares +12.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • CAKE

    Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE) guides on its Q4 earnings call (webcast) for revenue of...

    Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE) guides on its Q4 earnings call (webcast) for revenue of $435M-$440M and EPS of $0.34-$0.36, below a consensus of $443.8M and $0.40. Shares now -5.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • WIRE

    Encore Wire (NASDAQ:WIRE): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.45. Revenue of $248M (-3.1% Y/Y) misses...

    Encore Wire (NASDAQ:WIRE): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.45. Revenue of $248M (-3.1% Y/Y) misses by $15M. Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    During its FQ4 earnings call (webcast), Dell (DELL-OLD) blames its gross margin decline on hard...

    During its FQ4 earnings call (webcast), Dell (DELL-OLD) blames its gross margin decline on hard drive prices, mobile device write-offs, and government price cuts. The company also says it expects the first half of FY13 to be "challenging," and promises to allocate 10%-30% of its FY13 free cash flow to stock buybacks, which are lifting EPS in the face of tepid growth and margin pressure. Shares -4.9% AH. (earnings slides - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • RBBN

    Sonus Networks (SONS): Q4 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $74.3M (-10.5% Y/Y) beats by...

    Sonus Networks (SONS): Q4 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $74.3M (-10.5% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • FIRE

    Sourcefire (NASDAQ:FIRE): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $53.2M (+40% Y/Y) beats by...

    Sourcefire (NASDAQ:FIRE): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $53.2M (+40% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • PKT

    Procera Networks (NYSEMKT:PKT): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $15.6M (+108% Y/Y)...

    Procera Networks (NYSEMKT:PKT): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $15.6M (+108% Y/Y) beats by $4.1M. Bookings were $10M, 15 new service provider customers added. Company expects 2012 revenue growth of 30% (implied level of $57.7M, above $53.3M consensus). Shares +6.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • LZB

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ3 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $316.5M (+8.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ3 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $316.5M (+8.4% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • CHSI

    Catalyst Health Solutions (NASDAQ:CHSI): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $1.54B...

    Catalyst Health Solutions (NASDAQ:CHSI): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $1.54B (+37.5% Y/Y). Shares -15.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • TUDO

    Tudou (NASDAQ:TUDO) rises 4.7% AH after announcing its monthly video views reached 5.2B in...

    Tudou (NASDAQ:TUDO) rises 4.7% AH after announcing its monthly video views reached 5.2B in December (+100% Y/Y), and its monthly unique visitors reached 300M (per internal data). Tudou, China's second-largest online video site, also claims it's the most popular video-sharing platform for Sina's (NASDAQ:SINA) Weibo, accounting for an estimated 41% of Weibo's December video views.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) guides on its FQ1 earnings call (webcast) for FQ2 revenue of $530M-$545M...

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) guides on its FQ1 earnings call (webcast) for FQ2 revenue of $530M-$545M and EPS of $0.11-$0.12, roughly in-line with Street estimates of $536.9M and $0.12. BRCD +6.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • TXRH

    More on Texas Roadhouse's (NASDAQ:TXRH) Q4: Comparable restaurant sales +5.6% Y/Y. For 2012,...

    More on Texas Roadhouse's (NASDAQ:TXRH) Q4: Comparable restaurant sales +5.6% Y/Y. For 2012, sees 25 new restaurants and comparable restaurant sales growth of 4%-5%. Expects food cost inflation of 8%. Announces new $100M stock repurchase plan and increase in quarterly dividend payout to $0.09/share. Shares +7.7% AH. ( PR

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • HLF

    More on Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue as earnings jumped 25% Y/Y. Net...

    More on Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue as earnings jumped 25% Y/Y. Net sales set a record at $3.5B, a 26% increase over last year. The company also raises FY12 guidance, now seeing its EPS in a range between $3.40 - $3.60. Street estimates are at $3.48. Shares +3.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • TNGO

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO), which shot higher last week after reporting earnings, announces it's...

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO), which shot higher last week after reporting earnings, announces it's acquiring ttMobiles, a U.K.-based provider of management software for mobile devices and services. Tangoe expects the deal, which increases its European footprint, to boost its 2012 revenue by $4.5M and EPS by a penny. Shares +1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • CYH

    Community Health Systems (NYSE:CYH): Q4 EPS of $0.85 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $3.4B (+3.9%...

    Community Health Systems (NYSE:CYH): Q4 EPS of $0.85 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $3.4B (+3.9% Y/Y) misses by $140M. Shares -3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • TRAK

    DealerTrack Holdings (NASDAQ:TRAK): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $91.3M (+47.3%...

    DealerTrack Holdings (NASDAQ:TRAK): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $91.3M (+47.3% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares -4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • CAKE

    Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE): Q4 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $477M (+14.6% Y/Y)...

    Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE): Q4 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $477M (+14.6% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • ARC

    Affordable Residential Communities (NYSE:ARC): Q4 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.01. Revenue of...

    Affordable Residential Communities (NYSE:ARC): Q4 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $101.8M (-3% Y/Y) beats by $1.8M. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q4 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $884.6M (+19.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q4 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $884.6M (+19.8% Y/Y) beats by $28M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • FST

    Forest Oil (NYSE:FST): Q4 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $176M (-1.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Forest Oil (NYSE:FST): Q4 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $176M (-1.4% Y/Y) misses by $16M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    More on Dell's FQ4: Sales boosted by 12% Y/Y growth in services, and 60% Q/Q growth in...

    More on Dell's FQ4: Sales boosted by 12% Y/Y growth in services, and 60% Q/Q growth in proprietary storage. Server & networking sales rose 6% Y/Y, but that's down from FQ3's 13%. Business sales were healthy, but public and consumer revenue fell slightly. Asia-Pac and EMEA sales rose, while the Americas fell by 3%. Gross margin fell 150 bps Q/Q to 21.1% - that's likely to be a point of concern. DELL-OLD -4.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ) raises Q4 estimates, expecting solar module shipments of 430-440 MW...

    Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ) raises Q4 estimates, expecting solar module shipments of 430-440 MW against previous guidance of 340-360 MW, and against actual shipments of 287 MW in Q2 and 355 MW in Q3. The bump reflects stronger-than-expected demand from customers and the company still estimates gross margins to be 5-8%. Shares +9.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR): Q4 adjusted EPS from continued operations of $0.52 beats by $0.02....

    Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR): Q4 adjusted EPS from continued operations of $0.52 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.72B (+31% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Actual GAAP EPS of $0.30 adjusted by a $0.22/share impact for liability related to change of CEO. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade Communications Systems (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.07. Revenue of...

    Brocade Communications Systems (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $560.6M (+3% Y/Y) beats by $18M. Shares +7.6% AH.(PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) says it's reached a settlement agreement with the Sierra Club, Manasota-88,...

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) says it's reached a settlement agreement with the Sierra Club, Manasota-88, and People for Protecting the Peace River in litigation challenging the company's federal wetlands permit at its South Fort Meade mine. The settlement, which is subject to approval by the courts, will resolve all legal entanglements and allow mining to proceed. Shares +3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • UNM

    Unum (UNM +1.3%) closes higher after JP Morgan upped the shares to Overweight earlier today,...

    Unum (UNM +1.3%) closes higher after JP Morgan upped the shares to Overweight earlier today, citing improving price trends and a strong and flexible balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • FRO

    Frontline (FRO +8.6%) is raised to Outperform with a new $5.50 target price from $4.20 at...

    Frontline (FRO +8.6%) is raised to Outperform with a new $5.50 target price from $4.20 at FBR Capital, which sees limited downside risk at current levels with a restructured FRO having successfully reduced debt, managed new-build commitments, ensured lower rates for chartering arrangements, and the company's intention to steer a conservative course.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko (APC -2.5%) trades down after being cut to Neutral by JP Morgan, citing potential...

    Anadarko (APC -2.5%) trades down after being cut to Neutral by JP Morgan, citing potential downside risk from the Tronox litigation.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (ORCL -0.8%) trades lower after JMP Securities downgraded the shares to Market Perform...

    Oracle (ORCL -0.8%) trades lower after JMP Securities downgraded the shares to Market Perform earlier today, saying it believes the company's cloud efforts may take time to mature and increased enterprise adoption may reduce sales of its perpetual applications.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -10.2%) reported Q4 revenue that slightly beat consensus, but its per-share...

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -10.2%) reported Q4 revenue that slightly beat consensus, but its per-share loss was wider than expected. Nomura says it finds parts of BYD's results "curious," noting that Q4 Las Vegas Locals market gambling revenue grew 4% Y/Y while the segment's net revenue in the period grew only 0.4%, which could suggest a more promotional market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • KBR

    KBR (KBR +1.3%) gains on positive comments out of Goldman earlier this morning, saying the stock...

    KBR (KBR +1.3%) gains on positive comments out of Goldman earlier this morning, saying the stock is a top-pick in Energy Infrastructure names this quarter and expects 2012 guidance to drive shares higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • LPNT

    LifePoint Hospitals (LPNT -3.8%) trades down after being cut to Neutral on valuation at Baird...

    LifePoint Hospitals (LPNT -3.8%) trades down after being cut to Neutral on valuation at Baird earlier today, citing challenges to H1 growth and concerns over FY12 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney's (JCP -3.1%) turnaround hits a snag after Fitch cuts the retailer's rating to junk...

    J.C. Penney's (JCP -3.1%) turnaround hits a snag after Fitch cuts the retailer's rating to junk status, BB+ from BBB-. Fitch assumes reduced sales and negative free cash flow in 2012 as the company departs from its heavy promotion strategy to an everyday low price model.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • WELL

    Health Care REIT (HCN -2.3%) announces an 18M share secondary offering as the health-care...

    Health Care REIT (HCN -2.3%) announces an 18M share secondary offering as the health-care focused real-estate investment trust separately discloses it has completed $508M in acquisitions so far this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • ADM

    Archer Daniels Midland (ADM -1.1%) says it will slash 20% more jobs than it previously expected...

    Archer Daniels Midland (ADM -1.1%) says it will slash 20% more jobs than it previously expected in order to reduce costs. An exec with the firm says the 1.2K cuts will mostly hit employees in corporate roles, as opposed to workers in processing plants.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • YNDX

    Yandex (YNDX +6.7%) agrees to a partnership with Twitter that will allow the Russian search...

    Yandex (YNDX +6.7%) agrees to a partnership with Twitter that will allow the Russian search engine to show new tweets in its search results almost instantly. Twitter will give Yandex access to its firehose of all public tweets, the two companies say, in an agreement similar to the one it has with Microsoft's Bing search engine.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • NFLX

    Credit Suisse attempts triage on Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) - in a steep slide following the...

    Credit Suisse attempts triage on Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) - in a steep slide following the announcement of Comcast's VOD move - saying the impact will be limited as Comcast's service is only offered to existing subscribers. Netflix remains at the day's lows, -3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 4 Comments
  • FUN

    Shares of Cedar Fair (FUN +2.6%) rally off the firm's narrower-than-expected loss for Q4. The...

    Shares of Cedar Fair (FUN +2.6%) rally off the firm's narrower-than-expected loss for Q4. The amusement park operator notes in a conference call that both attendance and in-park guest spending increased for the quarter, helped in large part by a strong Halloween season at its properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (MOS +2.9%) is worth more if it’s broken up, Goldman Sachs says in calculating that...

    Mosaic (MOS +2.9%) is worth more if it’s broken up, Goldman Sachs says in calculating that the market is assigning a 6.5-7x multiple on 2013 EBITDA, which the firms calls undervalued because it represents a 30-40% discount to Potash's (POT) mines as well as a 20% discount to potash peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD -4.3%), crushed on Friday thanks to disappointing trial data, slumps some...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD -4.3%), crushed on Friday thanks to disappointing trial data, slumps some more following a downgrade to Equal Weight from Barclays. The firm believes Gilead will be just "one of several players" in the hepatitis C drug market, rather than the "majority leader," and as a result expects peak sales of its GS-7977 drug to be well below Street expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • FMC

    FMC Corp. (FMC +1.6%) moves up after saying late Friday it plans repurchase an additional $250M...

    FMC Corp. (FMC +1.6%) moves up after saying late Friday it plans repurchase an additional $250M of its common shares and increase its dividend by 20% to $0.18 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • CF

    Shares of CF Industries (CF +3.7%) push ahead after Scotia Capital raises its target price...

    Shares of CF Industries (CF +3.7%) push ahead after Scotia Capital raises its target price to $215 from $190, citing an improved nitrogen outlook, mostly on the back of strong crop prices, lower feedstock costs and high marginal exporter floor prices. Also, CF is generating free cash flow faster than it knows how to spend it - "a good problem to have," in the firm's view.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • CHH

    Choice Hotels (CHH +3.8%) says growth in domestic revenue per available room rose 7.8% in Q4 and...

    Choice Hotels (CHH +3.8%) says growth in domestic revenue per available room rose 7.8% in Q4 and current-quarter growth continues to trend in the high single-digits, as the hotel chain forecasts 2012 profits above consensus. "We believe recent employment gains in the U.S. bode well for leisure demand," CEO Steve Joyce adds during the conference call.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • AONEQ

    Volatile A123 Systems (AONE +2.3%) moves higher after introducing its Military 6T Battery, a...

    Volatile A123 Systems (AONE +2.3%) moves higher after introducing its Military 6T Battery, a lithium ion system meant to be a replacement for the lead acid batteries currently used in most military vehicles. A123 claims its battery is lighter and lasts longer than lead-acid alternatives, though it likely also costs more.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • CHTP

    Shares of Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP -30%) get hammered on an FDA report that says Northera, the...

    Shares of Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP -30%) get hammered on an FDA report that says Northera, the biotech company's drug to treat a condition that can cause dizziness in people with nervous system disorders, may be unsafe and shouldn't be approved.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.1%) keeps the pressure on Kazuo Okada with a new lawsuit filed in a Nevada...

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.1%) keeps the pressure on Kazuo Okada with a new lawsuit filed in a Nevada court that accuses the shareholder of "improper acts," including violating the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. Though the mud continues to get slung by lawyers for Wynn and Okada, investors remain focused on the nifty 30% discount the firm may pull off on the repurchase of Okada's shares if the action survives a legal challenge.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • AAL

    Airline stocks take a tumble as oil prices show strong gains tied to more saber-rattling by...

    Airline stocks take a tumble as oil prices show strong gains tied to more saber-rattling by Iran. The sector is engulfed in red on worries of higher costs for aviation fuel, led by sharply declining LCC -12.3%, DAL -10.3%, UAL -9.7%, JBLU -8.9%, ALGT -8.3%, LUV -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • MDT

    Shares of Medtronic (MDT -2.7%) drift lower after missing on its FQ3 earnings earlier today....

    Shares of Medtronic (MDT -2.7%) drift lower after missing on its FQ3 earnings earlier today. Revenues actually rose marginally Y/Y, as the medical-device maker benefited from fewer charges and the impact of divesting its Physio-Control business. The company also narrowed its per-share earnings estimate for the year, now expecting to earn between $3.44 - $3.47 versus earlier estimates of $3.43 - $3.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • CMCSA

    Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) announces Streampix - a subscription-based VOD service aimed at Netflix...

    Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) announces Streampix - a subscription-based VOD service aimed at Netflix (NFLX -2%), which tumbles 4% from the day's high. The service will be offered free or for $4.99 depending on a subscriber's particular Comcast package, but a subscription to Comcast's TV and broadband services will be required.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • MOH

    Medicaid insurer Molina Healthcare (MOH -3.3%) dips after lowering its FY earnings guidance by...

    Medicaid insurer Molina Healthcare (MOH -3.3%) dips after lowering its FY earnings guidance by $0.05 and saying it expects to take a Q4 charge due to the loss of a contract in Missouri.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • NVE

    NV Energy (NVE -2.4%) trades lower after missing Q4 estimates earlier today. Earnings swung to a...

    NV Energy (NVE -2.4%) trades lower after missing Q4 estimates earlier today. Earnings swung to a surprise loss in the fourth quarter as results were hurt by outages, accounting and regulatory adjustments, and expenses related to the completion of one of its facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • MMM

    3M (NYSE:MMM) is partnering with Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) to develop and sell a family of...

    3M (NYSE:MMM) is partnering with Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) to develop and sell a family of compressed natural gas (CNG) tanks for vehicles. The companies boast their tanks will be cheaper, lighter, and safer than current solutions, while offering 10%-20% more capacity. Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +2.7%), which in July received a $150M investment from Chesapeake, is rallying on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • RSH

    RadioShack (RSH -7.6%) CEO Jim Gooch adds more color on the firm's Sprint-fueled challeges in an...

    RadioShack (RSH -7.6%) CEO Jim Gooch adds more color on the firm's Sprint-fueled challeges in an earnings CC, saying that even incremental gains in its AT&T and Verizon business couldn't offset the Sprint sales and margins underperformance. "The trend worsened as tightening of the credit model combined with their early upgrade change to further deteriorate our trend."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • BAC

    It's not too late to buy Bank of America (BAC +1.7%), Second Curve's Thomas Brown surmises, "not...

    It's not too late to buy Bank of America (BAC +1.7%), Second Curve's Thomas Brown surmises, "not because they’re going to become a great banking company, but because the valuation of the company is just too low relative to even their weak earning potential... If we [can] just get it back to tangible book value, we’ve had a pretty good investment."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 9 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +1.4%) moves up after saying it's launching the start-up of Project Phoenix, a new...

    Molycorp (MCP +1.4%) moves up after saying it's launching the start-up of Project Phoenix, a new rare-earth manufacturing operation at its flagship Mountain Pass California facility this week, ahead of its April 1st deadline.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • IMAX

    Imax (IMAX +6.2%) shares move on last Friday's news that China and the U.S. reached a deal that...

    Imax (IMAX +6.2%) shares move on last Friday's news that China and the U.S. reached a deal that would "significantly increase" market access for U.S. films in the China market. China currently limits imports of foreign films to 20 per year. Two weeks ago, Imax announced agreements to install four new digital Imax theater systems into multiplexes across China.
